TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Volatile extends System.Object
public ref class Volatile abstract sealed

summary.span: 包含用于执行可变内存操作的方法。

span.span: Contains methods for performing volatile memory operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在多处理器系统上，易失性写入操作可确保写入内存位置的值立即对所有处理器都可见。On a multiprocessor system, a volatile write operation ensures that a value written to a memory location is immediately visible to all processors. 易失性读取操作可获取由任何处理器写入内存位置的最新值。A volatile read operation obtains the very latest value written to a memory location by any processor. 这些操作可能需要刷新处理器缓存，这可能会影响性能。These operations might require flushing processor caches, which can affect performance. > [!NOTE] > 在单处理器系统上，可变读和写确保将值读取或写入内存而不缓存（例如，在处理器寄存器中）。On a uniprocessor system, volatile reads and writes ensure that a value is read or written to memory and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，您可以使用这些操作来同步对可以由其他线程或硬件更新的字段的访问。Thus, you can use these operations to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread or by hardware. 可变内存操作适用于特殊情况下的同步，在这种情况下，不能使用常规锁定。Volatile memory operations are for special cases of synchronization, where normal locking is not an acceptable alternative. 在正常情况下， C# `lock`语句、Visual Basic `SyncLock`语句和类提供同步访问数据的最简单且最不容易出错的方法，并且类提供简单的方法是，无需直接使用双选锁定即可编写延迟初始化代码。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide the easiest and least error-prone way of synchronizing access to data, and the class provides a simple way to write lazy initialization code without directly using double-checked locking. 和 方法启用语言不支持的功能。The and methods enable functionality that is not supported in languages. 例如:For example: - 某些语言（如 Visual Basic）无法识别易失性内存操作的概念。Some languages, such as Visual Basic, do not recognize the concept of volatile memory operations. 类提供此类语言的功能。The class provides that functionality in such languages. > [!NOTE] > 调用这些方法之一只会影响单个内存访问。Calling one of these methods affects only a single memory access. 若要为字段提供有效同步，对字段的所有访问都必须使用和。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use and . - 在C#中，对`volatile`字段使用修饰符可保证对该字段的每个访问都是易失性内存`volatile`操作，但修饰符不能应用于数组元素。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that every access to that field is a volatile memory operation, but the `volatile` modifier cannot be applied to array elements. 和 方法可用于数组元素。The and methods can be used on array elements.

span.span: volatile keyword (C# Reference)

summary.span: 读取字段值。

span.span: Reads the value of a field.

summary.span: 在需要它的系统上，插入一个内存屏障，阻止处理器对内存操作重新排序，如下所示：如果在代码中读取或写入出现在此方法之后，处理器不能将其移到此方法之前。

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears after this method in the code, the processor cannot move it before this method.

span.span: This value is the latest written by any processor in the computer, regardless of the number of processors or the state of processor cache.

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears before this method in the code, the processor cannot move it after this method.
